name: Worldwide Mix Quiz | Wide World of Sports | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who finished runner-up to Patrick Rafter in the 1997 US Open?
questions.explanation:
Greg Rusedski.

	The former Canadian-born golfer turned professional in 1991.  This was Rusedski's only Grand Slam final appearance.

questions.text: With a high score of 173 in tests, this cricket Blackcap for New Zealand was one of their greatest wicketkeepers.  Who is this?
questions.explanation:
Ian Smith.

	He made his test debut against Australia at Brisbane in 1980.  He was later a commentator for Sky Sport.

questions.text: Which of the following never scored in a FA Cup soccer final?
questions.explanation:
Frank Lampard.

	Hughie Ferguson scored in the 1927 FA Cup Final where Cardiff beat Arsenal 1-0.  Kanu scored in the 2008 FA Cup Final.  Owen scored in the FA Cup Final on more than one occasion.

questions.text: Which professional sport did Richard Gasquet play?
questions.explanation:
Tennis.

	Gasquet was born in 1986 in France.  His first professional match was at Monte Carlo.  He was the youngest tennis player ever to qualify for a tennis masters event.

questions.text: Which of these teams was the first to win five IRB (rugby) Sevens Series titles?
questions.explanation:
New Zealand.

	When Fiji won their first title, New Zealand had already won eight, while Argentina and England had no wins.

questions.text: How many times did Andre Agassi win at Wimbledon?
questions.explanation:
1.

	Agassi won his only Wimbledon title in 1992 by defeating Goran Ivanisevic in the final.

questions.text: This cricket great made his Test debut against Australia in 1980, where he scored 6 not out with bowling figures of 18 overs, 5 maidens, 51 runs, 1 wicket, and an economy rate of 2.83. He also coached New Zealand for a number of years.  Who was this?
questions.explanation:
John Bracewell.

	John Bracewell replaced Denis Aberhart as coach of the Blackcaps.

questions.text: Which NBA star was known as the "Hick from French Lick"?
questions.explanation:
Larry Bird.

	Bird was many NBA Championship titles with the Boston Celtics.  Larry and Magic Johnson  of the Lakers both came into the NBA at the same time, and had a very known, but friendly rivalry throughout the years.  Bird later went on to coach the Indiana Pacers.

questions.text: In Euro 2008, how many goals did Turkey score in the final 15 minutes to defeat the Czech Republic, and to deny them a spot in the quarterfinals?
questions.explanation:
3.

	Two of the three goals scored by Turkey were scored in the final 3 minutes of the game.

questions.text: Which of these French stars made a run all the way to the semi-finals of their home tournament, the French Open in 2008?
questions.explanation:
Gael Monfils.

	Ranked number 59 in the world, Gael Monfils took Roger Federer to 4 sets in the 2008 semi-finals before finally losing the 4th set and match, 7-5.  Federer went on to lose the final to Rafael Nadal.
